definition: Don Quixote/also written 堂吉訶德|堂吉诃德[Tang2 ji2 he1 de2]
to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Inside every Sancho Panza there's a Don Quixote struggling to get out.
sentences.chinese: 每一个桑丘内心都有一个努力要挣脱出来的唐吉诃德。

sentences.english: Don Quixote was sure that he was the right man to be a knight -errant.
sentences.chinese: 唐吉诃德确信自己就是成为游侠的适当人选。

sentences.english: Don Quixote and Sancho ride into the woods of the Sierra Morena.
sentences.chinese: 唐吉诃德和桑丘骑到老虎伍兹的谢拉莫雷纳。

sentences.english: Don Quixote looked, and saw the squire with the long, pointed nose.
sentences.chinese: 唐吉诃德望过去，看到那个鼻子长长尖尖的随从。

sentences.english: Don Quixote was a hero of my father's, and my father would like you.
sentences.chinese: 唐吉诃德是我父亲的英雄，我父亲肯定会喜欢你。

sentences.english: Don Quixote allowed them to carry away their hurt companions.
sentences.chinese: 唐吉诃德任他们把受伤的同伙带走。

sentences.english: Don Quixote said he would make him governor of it as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 而唐吉诃德说会尽早让他成为海岛的总督。

sentences.english: Then again the squire aimed a great blow at Don Quixote.
sentences.chinese: 然后，随从又瞄准唐吉诃德砍了重重的一剑。

sentences.english: He was just going to take out the armour when Don Quixote again lifted his lance.
sentences.chinese: 他正要把甲胄拿出来，唐吉诃德又举起他的长矛。

definition: Cervantes/abbr. for 米格爾·德·塞萬提斯·薩維德拉|米格尔·德·塞万提斯·萨维德拉[Mi3 ge2 er3 · de2 · Sai1 wan4 ti2 si1 · Sa4 wei2 de2 la1]
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
The Good Soldier Švejk (Schweik), satirical novel by Czech author Jaroslav Hašek (1883-1923)
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
SHIBA Ryotarō (1923-1996), Japanese author of historical novels
Alexandr Sergeevich Pushkin (1799-1837), great Russian romantic poet
variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]
Prosper Mérimée (1803-1870), French scholar and writer, author of novel Carmen on which Bizet based his opera
